notesStmt.note: One leaf missing after folio 130 and 168 respectively. Folio 3 is a recent restoration. Folios 1-2 and 186-187 are vellum. Several pages water-damaged. First few leaves damaged, preserved on paper.

Folios 1r-2v, 186r-187vand contain Deuteronomy, chapters 13:7-18, 15:13-16:15, 30:20-31:10: Hebrew text with the sublinear punctuation, Targum with the simple superlinear puntuation, and Sa'adia Gaon's Arabic version in Hebrew characters. Has masorah magna and parva. Daṿid ben Sa῾id: stamped, folio 109v.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Midrash ha-gadol on Leviticus, attributed to David Adani.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite semi-cursive script of early 17th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 13 December 1879, inscribed, folio [188v].
